items.title: Hotjar: Product UX Researcher (EMEA)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Product UX Researcher (EMEA)

 
Note: Although this is a remote position, we are only looking for candidates in European timezones between UTC-1 and UTC+3.


At Hotjar, we’re building Behavior Analytics software for businesses selling online. We make it easy for them to go beyond traditional web analytics and understand what users are really doing on their site.


We’re looking for a passionate and motivated Product UX Researcher able to oversee the voice of the user in our Product and Engineering organization. Reporting to our Director of Product Design, you’ll guide discovery and exploratory projects within multiple squads, while educating and coaching members in ethnography and interviewing.


Hotjar is a flourishing startup that gives thousands of website owners, teams and professionals thetools needed to discover how their visitors are really using their sites. This is an excellent remote career opportunity within the P&E organization, playing a part in delivering the next wins for Hotjar.


You will:

  • Plan and execute participant recruiting for multiple squads and teams, and own our user advisory panel.
  • Design and execute discovery phases, usability tests and exploratory research projects using both quantitative and qualitative practices, and convert the findings into actionable insights.
  • Work on research deliverables that can be shared across the organization: user personas, empathy maps, customer mapping, allowing our team to build a product strategy that is aligned with the voice of our user.
  • Partner with product and engineering leads and directors to ensure both strategic and tactical priorities are well-defined and are set up to achieve a high impact, always obsessing over our users.
  • Own the voice of the user to help the team achieve the right solution, at the right time.
  • Educate the team towards success. Ensure individuals have research support to progress and complete their objectives.
  • Collaborate closely with Experience Design leadership to provide a consistent experience in all our Hotjar touch-points.
Requirements

  • Experience working autonomously and transversally across teams. Experienced and well versed in both execution and coordination of research projects.
  • You approach product/UX research with user-centric practices.
  • You have experience coaching and educating teams about the benefits of introducing user-centric practices and frameworks.
  • Mastery in product development discovery phases.
  • You have a demonstrated ability to promote insights across groups, multiple squads, and tribes.
  • Experience acting as a UX researcher from an experience design operations department, satisfying squads, and team’s user needs.
  • A natural inclination to always think MVP first.
  • Experience leading user testing sessions, ethnographic interviews, and complex data analysis.
  • Desire to work in a respectful, transparent, and collaborative work environment, in line with Hotjar’s company values, culture and ways of working.
  • Must submit to a background check confidentially processed by our third-party.


What we offer

  • Work from home or from virtually wherever you want in the EMEA.
  • A healthy work-life balance, with 40 days of paid leave (including public holidays)
  • Annual Personal Development Budget of €1,000, Annual Holiday Budget of €2,000, Wellbeing Allowance of €200 per month
  • And even more perks designed for your wellbeing and a healthy work-life balance. (Working Together Budget, 16 weeks paid Parental Leave, Working Space Allowance, Sick Leave and much more)


Compensation Range

The budgeted compensation range for this role is €55,000 to €75,000 annually (we do not have a commission or bonus scheme at Hotjar). Ranges are based on market research and are equitable to other roles within Hotjar. The actual compensation offered will be based on relative experience. At this time we are only able to provide official employment status to those located in Malta, the UK and Germany. All other candidates will join our team as full-time consultants and will be responsible for paying any taxes or applicable fees where they reside.

items.title: User Interface Design Tutor and Mentor
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Remote | Freelance | International
  • Location: Anywhere
  • Classifications: Remote Freelance

We created CareerFoundry to help others build their careers while maintaining personal freedom and flexibility. Our 100% online, flexible and Mentor/Tutor driven courses are setting the standard for globally accessible technical education.

We are looking for experienced and passionate UI designers all over the world to join our pool of experts and help define the next generation of design talent by educating and empowering students across the globe. Our global team of over 200 Mentors and Tutors in the web development, UX design, and UI design fields has grown to include freelancers, entrepreneurs, consultants, and agency directors who passionately guide, motivate, and empower our students to create new careers in the tech industry. We are constantly searching for more teaching enthusiasts like you to join us.

YOUR MISSION:

Mentoring and Tutoring with CareerFoundry is more than teaching. It is inspiring newcomers to the field to build, to problem solve, to think like a designer, and to increase their value as professionals. With their expertise from the field, our Mentors and Tutors provide guidance and encouragement to their students each step of the way, from sketching their first wireframe, to producing finished, functional interfaces that work across different platforms.

Based on your application and experience, we will make a decision on whether the Tutor or Mentor role is the perfect fit for you.

Tutor role:

With their expertise from the field, Tutors work with Mentors to provide guidance and encouragement to their students each step of the way. To do this, Tutors provide feedback and constructive criticism on submissions, help students understand the lessons, and ask and answer questions about the materials to deepen their understanding of the core concepts.

You’ll be:

  • Regularly reviewing student projects submitted through the CareerFoundry platform
  • Portfolio reviews and checking for fundamental understanding of concepts
  • Working alongside a Mentor (who has 8+ years of experience)
  • Suggesting supplemental learning materials and personal insights in areas where students are struggling
  • Responding to students within 12 -24 hours

Mentor role:

Most students will be beginners and are looking not only for help and experience to master the necessary skills, but also inspiration and motivation to keep them focused along the way. Mentors review students work on a regular basis with a view to how it would fit into an industry-ready portfolio. Additionally, they book one-on-one video calls to help prepare students for their entry into this new industry. They’re going to want to know how you got your start, how you network, how you decide which companies and roles to go for, and much more!

Your role would involve:

  • Reviewing student projects submitted through the CareerFoundry platform
  • Portfolio reviews and checking for fundamental understanding of concepts
  • Working alongside a Tutor
  • Suggesting supplemental learning materials and personal insights in areas where students are struggling
  • Responding to students within 48 hours

Requirements:

To succeed as a Mentor or Tutor, you need to have a real drive to pass on your secrets for success to the next generation of design talent.

Tutor role

  • 2+ years of professional UI design experience
  • A great portfolio to support your experience
  • Basic UX design knowledge and abilities are appreciated
  • In depth knowledge of industry best practices
  • A friendly personality and a strong desire to help others

Mentor role

  • You have 5+ years’ experience in UI design, with a demonstrable track record showcasing your work for a variety of clients and companies.
  • A first class portfolio with rock solid, relevant references to back it up.
  • Ideally, you will already have gained experience in teaching or you have the right attitude and skills for it: you have time and patience for beginners and a strong desire to guide people along their career path in this field, with knowledge of the latest design tools, a broad network of experts in the field and an in-depth understanding of industry practices.

What’s in it for you:

  • Flexible and mobile– work from anywhere with an internet connection
  • Educational – deepen your own knowledge of UI design by teaching it to others, plus work alongside a Mentor or Tutor who will also assist with your own professional development
  • Fulfilling – directly impact students’ personal growth, and help them succeed in their goals
  • Résumé gold – mentoring and teaching experience is highly sought after by employers everywhere
Apply for job

items.content:
Remote
  • Location: United States
  • Classifications: Remote Full-Time

Are you looking to make a difference in a patient’s life? At AmerisourceBergen, you will find an innovative culture that is patient focused and dedicated to making a difference. As an organization, we are united in our responsibility to create healthier futures.

What you will be doing

AmerisourceBergen is looking for a passionate, innovative and experienced Product Design Lead to join our growing product design team and lead the next iteration of our design system. Under the direction of the Director of User-Centered Design this role is responsible for the vision, build out and ongoing operations of our design system that enables our product teams to rapidly design and build a consistent user experience and interface across the enterprise by providing: components, frameworks, documentation and tooling.

The Product Design Lead will:

  • Lead the design and delivery of our design system and drive implementation of our brand in our products
  • Own the design system roadmap for the enterprise
  • Drive the evolution of our visual language in coordination with our design leaders
  • Establish and promote values, principles, and best practices
  • Introduce, maintain, and advance standard tools and processes that enable repeatable and scalable success
  • Create a focal point in the enterprise for design, a common design language, scalable design systems and libraries
  • Support and participate in the community of practice that facilitates collaboration for prospective, new and seasoned UCD practitioners

A successful candidate should:

  • Exhibit passion about creating innovative products and bring thought leadership and best in class product design skills to create positive user experiences and user research to guide our tribes and squads in meeting the needs of diverse stakeholders and customers
  • Be an expert communicator who builds strong relationships and partnerships focusing on collaboration, building consensus and driving design through influence
  • Be an analytical thinker, with a desire and ability to develop and document a deep understanding of the organization’s needs and evolve the UCD practice across product and non-product landscapes
  • Manage, mentor, coach, and pair with all levels of roles within the UCD job family to support their development and continuous progress
  • Support the User-Centered Design Center of Competence build out and champions the sustainability of best practices for Product Design
  • Manage implementation of the design system across the product ecosystem
  • Design and define interaction patterns through components, documentation, and prototypes
  • Work with developers to maintain and create new components for our library
  • Directly partner with and support product designers in utilizing the design system
  • Curate new patterns from design team suggestions and be the gatekeeper for additions
  • Participate in user research and testing as needed to ensure usability and product consistency
  • Create work that scales and flexes across a variety of audiences, abilities, devices, and platforms
  • Specify and maintain our core principles in visual style, typography, spacing, motion, and interaction models
  • Reinforce consistency and coherence across our design system, and identify areas for improvements
  • Build and maintain documentation for the design system that enables designers and developers to use the design system
  • Full time Remote work available

#LI-DN1

What your background should look like (minimum qualifications):

Bachelor’s degree required. Master’s degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI) or equivalent professional experience is required. 8+ years experience in digital product design for both web and mobile platforms. Have experience in designing and managing design systems for both consumer facing and enterprise facing products. Have experience working on complex enterprise software and consumer software; working across multiple devices including web app, android, and iOS. Experience working in a mixed methodology environment (waterfall and agile). Experience designing graphic user interfaces for complex applications. Strong product design strategy skills in areas of consumer/user research and analysis, personas and customer journeys, design thinking, ideation and brainstorming techniques, sketching, prototyping, and concept validation. Expert ability to understand & create product strategies, journey maps, user-flows, and content structure. Advanced experience leading, coaching, and mentoring product design teams. Knowledge of how HTML, CSS, JavaScript and other web languages impact design process and development. Excellent presentation, communication, documentation and organization skills.

  • Strong executive presence, including ability to partner with and effectively influence senior leadership
  • Skilled at communicating verbally and in writing to diverse audiences
  • Thought leader and Change agent willing to challenge norms and grow peers’ thinking
  • Proactive self-starter; assertive and able to ensure that Product Design principles are adhered to
  • Strong prioritization skills and ability to quickly re-prioritize in a dynamic environment
  • Analytical mindset and creativity to balance detailed problem solving with ‘big picture’ strategic view

What AmerisourceBergen offers:

We offer competitive total rewards compensation. Our commitment to our associates includes benefit programs that are comprehensive, diverse and designed to meet the various needs across our associate population.

  • Healthcare for associates and eligible dependents, same-sex and domestic partners
  • Paid time off, including vacations and holidays
  • Paid volunteer time off
  • Life insurance and disability protection
  • Pet insurance
  • Employee Stock Purchase Program
  • Retirement benefits and more…

Throughout our global footprint and various business units, we take a balanced approach to the benefits we offer. Many benefits are company-paid, while others are available through associate contributions. Specific benefit offerings may vary by location, position and/or business unit.

About AmerisourceBergen

AmerisourceBergen is a publicly traded Fortune 10 global healthcare solutions company and is one of the world’s largest pharmaceutical services companies. Powered by our associates around the world, we provide pharmaceutical products and business solutions that improve access to care. We operate the backbone of the healthcare supply chain. We drive the future of local care delivery. We guide medical innovations to market. We create healthier futures.

Apply for job

items.content:
Remote | International

Position

SOFTGAMES is looking for a solid and talented Senior User Interface (UI) Game Artist (remote or Berlin) to help create amazing User Experiences for our social mobile games for Facebook and the App Stores.

The ideal candidate should have a keen eye for detail, are great problem solvers and have passion for User Interface design and experiences. The candidate will be responsible for creating and improving art assets for menus, icons and in-game HUDs. Furthermore the ideal candidate will design intuitive, attractive and functional UI systems while paying special attention to the quality of the user experience.

Qualified applicants will be expected to complete a graphics test.

Please note: this is a remote position. No relocation to Berlin necessary.

Your role will consist in:

  • Creating the visual design from concept stage to implementation
  • Designing UI animations, transitions and visual effects
  • Documenting UI style guides
  • Working in synergy with developers and designers, delivering assets in accordance to the project’s technical and feature requirements
  • Concisely communicating your ideas about improving screen flows and game features from the perspective of the user experience
  • Demonstrating creativity and adaptability to a variety of artistic styles

Your profile:

  • Fluent in English, strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • 5+ years experience in creating polished, visually appealing, user friendly, consistent and distinct user interface art assets (e.g. buttons, menus, icons and animation.)
  • Advanced proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite
  • Experience with 2D Animation and Visual Effects
  • Passionate about games!

Bonus skills:

  • Experience with casual games (45+ female core audience)
  • Experience in user interface design for mobile and web games
  • Great sense of composition and colour

We offer:

  • An opportunity to work with international and highly motivated professionals in the fast-evolving Instant Games business
  • An exciting job where you can assume responsibility and develop professionally
  • Flexible working-hours and flat company hierarchy

About SOFTGAMES
With offices in Berlin, Germany and Toronto, Canada, SOFTGAMES is a leading developer of the most popular Social Games on Facebook and for the App Stores with tens of million users every month. Our vision is to help users to instantly play great games with their friends. To-date, more than 100 MM people have played our games on Facebook Messenger, including Cookie Crush, Solitaire Story, Mahjong Story, Space Invaders, Fish Story, Bubble Shooter or Candy Rain.

items.title: UX Design for social enterprise
items.content:
EduKit is launching a wellbeing app for primary and secondary aged children. Designed to help them through the current crisis, their return to school under social distancing and the transition to the 'new normal' it will be a fun, engaging app that will ensure that vital emotional and mental health support gets to those children who need it most. We already have pre-orders from schools and plan to launch in beta within the next 4 weeks. 


We are looking for an experienced User Experience expert to join our team, working a 2-3 days a week. Their goal would be to hep us to create an engaging and enjoyable app experience for users; proposing and testing features that will encourage regular usage and create habit forming behaviour.


Applicants should have a passion for transforming young lives and ideally have solid relationships with relevant media outlets already in place. Experience of education or mobile app launches would also be very helpful.


We are London-based but even before the lockdown we were a remote-working company. Candidates from across the UK are preferred but international candidates are also very welcome to apply. We're excited to hear from you!

items.content:
Remote
  • USA – Remote
  • United Kingdom – Remote
  • Full time
  • R1002

At CrowdStrike we’re on a mission – to stop breaches. Our groundbreaking technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering together with our innovations in machine learning and behavioral-based detection, allow our customers to not only defend themselves, but do so in a future-proof manner. We’ve earned numerous honors and top rankings for our technology, organization and people – clearly confirming our industry leadership and our special culture driving it. We also offer flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives in a way that works for them. So if you’re ready to work on unrivaled technology where your desire to be part of a collaborative team is met with a laser-focused mission to stop breaches and protect people globally, let’s talk.

About the Role

In this role as a User Interface/Visual Designer on the UX team, your primary stakeholders will be your peers — helping them succeed in creating a world-class experience across our applications. We’re looking for a detail-oriented collaborator who can work with a growing design team to establish good systematic practices for creating and maintaining beautiful, usable designs.

You’ll primarily do that by organizing and maintaining design libraries that enable the team to layout and prototype data-rich interfaces with consistent user experience. You’ll be an important voice in how these design components are documented and implemented in a living design system that improves the quality and speed of how the UX team designs and codes.

You’ll work without our Platform product group and be joining a cross-functional, global UX team composed of designers, researchers, writers & engineers collaborating closely to deliver the best possible experience for our customers.

We’re looking for candidates located in the US Central, US East, or UK London time zones working remotely, with the option of working in offices in either Minneapolis or London.

What you’ll be doing

  • Create visual, production-ready design components that follow the product design standards and can be reused across the design team
  • Organize and maintain a scalable design library for UX team using Sketch and other design tools
  • Collaborate with all UX disciplines to run a living design system for primary use by design, engineering, writing, and QA
  • Document design system components use cases and guidelines for reference
  • Collaborate with other designers on use of design system components and creation of new componentry
  • Participate in thoughtful critique of visuals and component patterns both remote and in person
  • Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team to advocate for user-centered experiences through visuals and communication
  • Ensure new components are data-informed and collaborate with researchers to ensure the right experience
  • Apply micro-interactions and animations where appropriate and work with development team on what’s feasible

What skills are we looking for

  • Exceptional portfolio of visual, interface, and interaction design
  • Deep knowledge of Figma and other tools to create and maintain design libraries
  • Clean and detailed design work on both presentation and organization of files
  • Experience working on design systems used by iterative product teams
  • Added bonus if worked on data visualization or SaaS products in the past
  • Additional bonus points for illustration skills

Benefits of Working at CrowdStrike:

  • Market leader in compensation and equity awards
  • Competitive vacation policy
  • Comprehensive health benefits
  • Paid parental leave, including adoption
  • Flexible work environment
  • Wellness programs
  • Stocked fridges, coffee, soda, and lots of treats

We are committed to building an inclusive culture of belonging that not only embraces the diversity of our people but also reflects the diversity of the communities in which we work and the customers we serve. We know that the happiest and highest performing teams include people with diverse perspectives and ways of solving problems so we strive to attract and retain talent from all backgrounds and create workplaces where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work.

CrowdStrike is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Apply for job

items.title: Creative and Digital Design Lead
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=38}
items.content:
Remote
  • Job Locations: US-PA-Harrisburg | US-NH-Manchester | US-Remote
  • Job ID: 2020-1424
  • Category: Marketing

Overview

As the creative and digital design lead, you will own the creation, direction and maintenance of our corporate, product and internal brands, and creative marketing assets. From concept through execution, you will improve our user knowledge, perception and experience by bringing our brand to life and keeping it consistent across our various touchpoints.

Responsibilities

  • Concept, art direct and manage the overall Geneia corporate, product, service and internal brands, ensuring they remain true to Geneia’s vision and core values.
  • Manage a small creative team to produce materials, creative assets, digital assets and internal materials.
  • Collaborate with marketing teammates to create and support website design and content marketing (email, landing pages, infographics, social media assets, e-newsletters, digital advertising, and more).
  • Collaborate with product development teams to provide UI/UX guidance and oversight, ensuring products actually reflect brand standards.
  • Provide design, UI/UX input, prototypes and review of Geneia web assets – Geneia.com, One.Geneia.com, My.Geneia.com and education.geneia.com. Serve as a member of the portals team, participating in the agile development process.
  • Help bring new ideas for design and content creation to the team using your expertise and eye for great design.
  • Scope and create templates for our marketing team to be more efficient in their posting on social media, the blog, email, and other channels.
  • Create and manage other design needs such as print and digital advertising; content assets such as white papers, case studies and eBooks; presentations; signage; trade show booth and collateral; product marketing materials and sales sheets; and other marketing materials as needed.
  • Collaborate with other members of marketing, sales, product, clinical and The Geneia Institute to ensure all creative and marketing materials adhere to Geneia brand and style consistency and integrity.
  • Work with printers, photographers and other vendors as needed to produce high-quality, professional marketing materials. Solid understanding of print production requirements such as layout, color, typography and file packaging.

Qualifications

  • Expert at responsive design with a mobile-first mentality.
  • Extensive experience with technologies like HTML, CSS, Flash, JavaScript, Bootstrap, Sketch.
  • Experience designing for template-driven systems like Sitefinity, Sitecore, Pardot, HubSpot, Exact Target, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, or other content management and e-commerce systems. This person must create assets for our team that are mobile-, tablet-, and desktop-friendly and provide a user experience that fits on all three screens.
  • Expert in Adobe Creative Suite, including Adobe XD, and similar visual design and wire-framing tools.
  • Fluent in the latest Web trends, techniques and technologies.
  • Experience managing a design team.
  • 7-10 years in graphic design, web design and digital content development
  • Bachelor’s degree required; advanced degree or certification in design and/or digital technologies helpful.

Please note: Our company does not support Macs. Our designers work in a Microsoft PC environment.

Geneia is an equal opportunity employer

items.content:
Salary: Highly competitive

Remote working, office based or a mixture - whatever suits you best

Most of our Dev Team have been with us 7+ years - says it all. Come and you will enjoy!

Ride a baby Unicorn

The Opportunity

OpenGenius: creators of such products as Ayoa, iMindMap and DropTask are looking for an exceptional visually-driven user interface designer to create elegant, customer-focused designs as part of our UX team to produce user-friendly, intuitive products that are able to attract and retain customers.

About you

You will need to be an analytical and creative designer who is able to understand user needs and problem-solve through your designs, collaborating with designers, developers, product testers and product managers – working on cross-platform products throughout the conceptual, design and development process.

A strong portfolio illustrating successful UI design is a must. Applicants without a portfolio won’t be considered.

We’re looking for someone who is passionate about UI/UX, preferably within visiting distance to our office. At present, we’re working 100% remotely. Ideally, you will be able to visit the office periodically once our situation changes.

Requirements

  • 2+ years of UI design experience or similar role. A strong portfolio of successful UI is required. Preference will be given to applicants with experience designing complex solutions across platforms.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Interactive Design, Graphic Design, or similar design-related fields.
  • Knowledge of best practices for mobile and web-based information architecture and design, usability principles and techniques, as well as experience with mobile-first and responsive design.
  • Experience in a variety of design tools such as Adobe CS, Affinity, Sketch and Invision and similar is a must; basic HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript skills are a plus.
  • A good understanding of user-centred design.
  • Excellent communicator (particularly with other remote workers)

Responsibilities

  • Design concise, useful, and desirable interfaces and experiences that are consistent across multiple platforms.
  • Create user-centred designs by considering market analysis, customer feedback and usability findings.
  • Design the UI architecture, interface, and interaction flow of applications and experiences.
  • Develop conceptual diagrams, wireframes, pixel-accurate mockups, click-through prototypes.
  • Develop and maintain detailed UI specifications and design patterns.
  • Quickly turning around rigorous flows and mockups reflecting a range of options.
  • Implementing and analysing user testing sessions and adapting to feedback and constructive criticism.
  • Working with project managers and board members to plan projects for effective delivery while maintaining high design standards.
  • Creating supporting design work for product websites, email and marketing campaigns.
  • Interacting and communicating with customers at events, product demonstrations as well as through support channels to gain first hand experience of how customers perceive and use the products you are designing.

Perks

  • Free use of onsite 5-star gym and shower rooms.
  • Free unlimited tea, hot chocolate and bean-to-cup coffee.
  • Flexible working hours
  • Happy Birthday – Take the day off, paid!
  • 20-27 days holiday + Bank holidays per year (accumulate an extra 2 days holiday every full year you are with us)
  • Regular company socials and events.

Work in one of the coolest office spaces in the UK

OpenGenius owns and is headquartered in the highly desirable offices at Tec Marina, Penarth. With plenty of free parking and just a short walk away from Cogan train station, you’ll be joining a well-connected, highly creative and collaborative community, passionate in developing innovative and creative software solutions.

We reward attitude, ability and performance. For the right candidate, this is an invaluable opportunity for business and career growth. If you’re looking to work within a driven, hard-working and committed team who are inspired to change the way that millions of people think and work for the better, we would love to hear from you. Apply now with a CV, portfolio and covering email explaining your experience & suitability for the role.

OpenGenius is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications regardless of sex, marital status, ethnic origin, disability, religion, sexual orientation or age.

items.content:
Senior Web Designer

We are looking for a thoughtful, detail-oriented web ui designer to be the next member of our growing developer-owned, remote-friendly, people-first, hyphen-loving company.

The ideal candidate would have several years of experience working on production web applications. They would have a strong desire to straddle our design and engineering teams, providing the glue needed to build beautiful and useful web applications. They would also be eager to learn, grow, and foster healthy working relationships.

If you have experience building production web applications and are as passionate about helping customers as you are about working with new technologies, then we want to talk!

Skills & Requirements

Do you love to work directly with customers to solve business problems?

We believe great software is discovered by understanding the core problems our clients are facing – and that is best achieved through frequent and direct communication with the subject matter experts. We provide leadership to support and guide interactions, but we need you to be comfortable talking with clients, discussing problems, and proposing solutions, which may not always be more software.

Do you have experience creating production web applications?

We strive to support our team's growth, learning, and taking on new roles at the edge of our comfort zones. At the same time, our clients expect us to bring a certain level of expertise. If you have never worked on a production web application, it is unlikely you will succeed here, even if you have other types of engineering experience.

Extensive production knowledge of HTML/CSS

You'll be mostly building web applications, so you'll need to be familiar with your tools, and have used your tools on a number of production web applications.

Experience with Design, UI and, prototyping tools

Comfortable using tools like Sketch, Adobe Suite, inVision, Zeplin, or Figma.

Are you able to work remotely, within +/- 2 hours of US Eastern time zone?

We all mostly work from home. This requires the ability to self-direct and communicate well in writing. It also offers tremendous freedom and power, which comes with, uh, tremendous responsibility. We currently require our team to be within a 2hr time zone difference of Richmond, VA and physically based in the United States. Exceptions can be made if you're willing to work east coast business hours.

Bonus Points

  • Being within easy driving distance of Richmond or Charlottesville is a huge plus!
  • Bonus for having some JavaScript experience, and being able to work within frontend frameworks like React or Vue.
  • Bonus for having user experience skills.

What We Offer
  • A Great Team - Our team of engineers and designers is the best part of working here. We only hire people who are fantastic teammates – competent and smart, sure, but also humble, positive, and generous.
  • Great Clients - We work with mostly small and medium clients, for whom our projects make a huge impact. We prioritize clients who are pleasant and good to work with, people who share our values of transparency and empathy.
  • Work From Home - We are a distributed company. Everyone works from home, though the leadership team all live in central Virginia.
  • Negligible Travel - In general, we don't travel routinely for projects. If this is a specific concern, we're happy to discuss.
  • Flexible Work Schedule - We require a certain amount of overlap with the rest of the team, but if you have a predictable schedule, we can probably support it, e.g., ending at 3:30 every day or being out every Friday morning.
  • Good Work Life Balance (really) - We ask our team to work 40 hours a week*. That's all: a good, productive 40 hours. And then we try our best to leave you alone off the clock. We do this in part because that's how we want to live but also because we want our team to be recharged and ready to do their best when working. *If you need to work fewer than 40 hours, that might be possible too; let’s talk.
  • Competitive Compensation - We offer highly competitive salary and benefits, including generous time off, 401k, FSA, medical and dental insurance.

items.title: Design and Video Editing Internship Q2 2020
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=2, frontend=0}
items.content:
What we are building


Property search is broken. In the future, tenants will instantly be matched to the homes and neighbourhoods that best meet their needs. SearchSmartly is building that future today.


What you’ll be doing


Our product team designs and delivers our promise to our users: a radically better property search experience. As a design intern, you will develop interactive wireframes, take part in user research calls and develop (on brand) visual assets for our product and landing pages. You’ll also gain experience working with engineers, senior stakeholders and clients. 


In addition to your regular product design tasks, we will co-create a business-critical project with you. This project will be tailored to your personal interests and the needs of the business, which means we’ll actually use what you build. Expect to spend at least 30% of your time on this project.


What you’ll get


We will embed you into our product development team’s bi-weekly sprints, weekly meetings and monthly strategy meetings. That means you will have an inside view of the scaling journey we are on, as well as the challenges we face as a business. Please note that this is an unpaid internship, but we can offer a basic allowance on lunch expenses. 


Eligibility


As this is an unpaid role, we can only accept applications from students (in a relevant degree) looking for work experience. As our team works wholly remote, we are happy to accept applications from international students as well.


You are 



  • Transparent: You are open, honest, and always uphold the trust of your team and stakeholders.

  • Thoughtfully Tenacious: You go the extra mile, every time, to delight our users with limited resources. Your thoughtfulness extends to your team, and you consider who will inherit your assets when you make them.

  • Continuously Learning: You are passionate about learning and care deeply about broadening your horizons and developing yourself. When it comes to design, you enjoy wearing multiple hats

  • A Deep Diver: You pay attention to the details and are skeptical about outcomes unless metrics tell us otherwise.


You have



  • Experience with high-fidelity prototyping tools such as Sketch, Adobe XD, or similar

  • A passion for great design and a vision for making complex things simple.

  • A modest portfolio of work that you can share with us as part of your application. 

  • Bonus: If you have interest in (or previous experience of) coding and/or video-editing, please let us know in your cover letter.

items.title: UX Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=21}
items.content:
Remote

Location: United States

The Role:

Are you passionate about K-12 education? Are you inspired by the idea that learning should be connected to life? Do you believe it takes a village to help a student succeed? We are Naviance by Hobsons, and we craft solutions that enable counselors, schools, and districts to help their students figure out who they are and get where they want to go. This position is a key member of our Naviance User Experience team who ensures our solutions are intuitive and engaging for users, across devices. This position includes facilitating a user-centered discovery process, as well as creating design concepts and prototypes that will improve the experience of our products, and help provide valuable solutions to students and education professionals.

The User Experience Designer serves as an expert across the various disciplines of user experience, including user research, information architecture, interaction design, content, analytics and accessibility. Join us and help students and institutions blaze a trail to better post secondary outcomes.

This position can be based anywhere in the US (Remote).

Essential Functions:

  • Collaborate with Product partners to ideate, craft, and facilitate recurring research initiatives, such as: user interviews, user focus groups, internal stakeholder feedback sessions and more.
  • Maintain cohesiveness among multiple products that live under the same platform using and extending our existing Design System.
  • Understand accessibility guidelines and collaborate with Product Managers and engineers to help meet accessibility standards.
  • Work with cross-product UX team members to provide applicable and predictable experiences across Hobsons platforms.
  • Work closely with PMs, engineers, and other team members to best fit optimal user experiences within the afforded project scope, budget, technical requirements, and business needs.
  • Propose user experiences and design recommendations in the form of wireframes and high-fidelity prototypes.
  • Assist with development and socialization of user archetypes, including personas, or contribute to existing ones as appropriate.
  • Collaborate with distributed teams through traditionally agile ceremonies (stand-up, sprint planning, retros) to ensure the desired user experience is carried through the development cycle.
  • Serve as UX representative for high-profile projects and cross-departmental meetings.

Ideal Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in user experience, interaction design, information architecture or related field, or equivalent years of related experience is required.
  • 3-6 years of UX experience with websites and/or web applications.
  • Education industry experience preferred.
  • Portfolio or examples showcasing experience in planning and creating intuitive digital experiences.
  • Understanding of usability and responsive design best practices.
  • Ability to own and articulate design decisions.
  • Proficiency with prototyping tools such as Sketch, InVision, Photoshop.
  • Knowledge of HTML5 & CSS is a plus.
  • Experience designing in an Agile environment that includes SaaS and B2B products preferred
  • Ability to collaborate with others.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Experience with agile development and scrum processes highly preferred.

About Hobsons:

A leader in education technology, Hobsons helps more than 15 million students to identify their strengths, explore careers, match to best-fit educational opportunities, create academic plans, and reach their education and life goals. More than 13,000 K-12 and higher education institutions partner with Hobsons and leverage our expertise and our solutions — Naviance, Intersect, and Starfish — to improve college and career readiness, college recruiting and admissions, and higher education student success to support millions of students.

Benefits Include:

  • Affordable and Competitive Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Plans
  • 401(k) Plan with Match
  • Flexible Paid Time-Off
  • Education/Tuition Reimbursement
  • Generous Holiday Schedule
  • Flexible Work Arrangement Opportunities
Apply for job

items.title: UX Researcher
items.content:
Remote | International
  • Location: Austin • Remote
  • Hires remotely: Everywhere
  • Job type: Full-time
  • Visa sponsorship: Available

Shogun is a powerful page builder platform for ecommerce stores, and we’re on a mission to empower anyone to easily create high converting ecommerce pages through a delightful product experience.

The Role

As a UX Researcher on our design team you will have a very specialized role in helping us understand our users and create empathy for their needs. You will connect product and design with the user, and translate user behaviour into actionable insights. You will work across multiple teams and bridge disciplines in an attempt to help us bring the best possible user experience to our products.

You Will

  • Help define our roadmap by advocating for our users needs
  • Work cross-functionally with product, design, support, and engineering
  • Facilitate user-testing and validate prototypes
  • Establish and enable UX Research as a practice throughout the company
  • Analyze data and insight into usable direction for product teams
  • Be an advocate for our users

You Have

  • Proven work experience as a UX Researcher
  • Ability to quickly identify and utilize the best UX Research methods for any given task
  • Experience conducting interviews, usability and accessibility testing, card sorting, eye tracking, and surveys remotely or ideas on how to accomplish these tasks
  • Familiarity with quantitative and qualitative data and how to utilize each properly
  • Ability to analyze data and utilize the results into direct recommendations
  • Proven ability to work autonomously and collaboratively
  • Excellent written communication skills

Bonus Points

  • You have worked remotely before
  • You have product design experience
  • You have worked in ecommerce or a similar field

Shogun Values

  • Work in the open: Operate with high integrity and choose what’s right over what’s easy. Be transparent as a company and with each other.
  • People are People: Treat yourself, colleagues, and customers with dignity, empathy, and respect. Start from a presumption of positive intent.
  • Win and grow together: Strive to be the best, individually and as a team. Support and encourage each other. Seek opportunities for growth

We offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Competitive equity
  • Benefits (vary by location)
  • Co-working office reimbursement
  • A highly skilled and dedicated team that is fun to work with.
  • Remote work – We are a fully distributed team
  • Occasionally we hire on a full time contractor basis to begin with. Team members enjoy the same opportunities for great compensation, full time positions, equity, and consideration, regardless of location.

Shogun supports workplace diversity and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity/expression, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other protected class

items.title: Web and Graphic Designer
items.content:
Upscope is looking for a part-time web and graphic designer, with the option of going **full time in Q3 2020.**


The Designer's main responsibilities will be maintaining our portfolio companies' public websites and marketing material. This includes Sales Decks, Implementation Documents, Ad banners and more.


Most of the existing material has been created by different people and we would like you to come in and re-evaluate our brand and come up with a consistent design system we can implement everywhere.


This role is very hands-on and you'll be our first design-only hire.


**Please send your portfolio, your weekly availability, and typical daily/hourly rate with your application.**


## We require the following skills


- Proven ability to provide imaginative and creative design solutions for web and digital media
- Proven ability and expertise in Adobe Creative Cloud, Indesign, and Photoshop and Illustrator
- Creative flair and ability to bring concepts to life
- Attention for detail—we like to see "pixel perfect" design
- Good understanding of UI and UX concepts
- Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to clearly articulate ideas.
- We sometimes do training videos and need help editing them. If you have any experience with that, it's a major plus


## Company Culture


As one of our early hires, your work will have a massive impact on the direction of the company. We are looking for someone who is able to work in a team and also independently.


It’s very important for us to get along with our colleagues and regardless of your location (office or remote), we want someone who is involved with us for more than just work and that is happy to bond over the occasional night out or team retreat.


Due to the nature of our small team, there will be times where work will need to be carried out at unusual times (e.g. production migrations, calls with clients in different time zones), and we expect you to be happy to stick around a bit longer when necessary.


That being said, we aim to offer a great level of work/life balance and don’t look for you to work more than 15-25 hours a week (dependent on what we agree), and in turn, we expect great quality work and self-motivation.


Our individual growth matters as much as the business outcomes. The business has to thrive but signs of personal growth are ones that give us the greatest sense of pride.

items.title: Graphic Design Intern
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=24, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=15}
items.content:
We’re looking for a pro-active, creative and ambitious intern to support the founder of the business to work creatively and build visual assets for the brand. The role is perfectly suited to a candidate who is highly motivated and has the ability to work creatively whilst using their own initiative.


 


The brand is focused on the entertainment industry, specialising in hen, engagement, birthday and baby shower parties. We are looking for a talented designer who is looking to develop their portfolio to a similar illustration style as the following: https://www.pinterest.co.uk/Invitee_app/branding-inspo/


 


 


 


Responsibilities






  • Create highly engaging complex animations for a diverse array of media, including smartphones, tablets and the web.

  • Assist in the creation of animation storyboards.

  • Prepare conceptual layouts for the motion graphic project.

  • Participate in brainstorming sessions to share new design perspectives and ideas.

  • Provide accurate time estimates for each part of the process.

  • Assist in selecting appropriate audio, graphic and animation styles for the project.

  • Encoding, converting and editing videos and adding effects/elements to enhance motion graphics.

  • Support the marketing team with photo editing, bespoke illustration and icon design.

  • Typesetting through to design, print and production

  • Developing concepts, graphics and layouts for product illustrations, company logos and websites

  • Determining size and arrangement of copy and illustrative material, as well as font style and size

  • Preparing rough drafts of material based on an agreed brief

  • Reviewing final layouts and suggesting improvements if required


 


Skills & Qualities






  • Strong illustration and graphics skills

  • Exceptional creativity and innovation

  • Excellent time management and organisational skills

  • Accuracy and attention to detail

  • An understanding of the latest trends and their role within a commercial environment

  • Ability to comprehend and uphold brand style guidelines

  • Ability to solve an array of challenges through visual design

  • Manage time effectively, ability to multi-task and meet deadlines

  • Self starter with the ability to work independently and collaborate with a team



 


Desired Skills and Experience 



  • Excellent knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, InDesign).  

  • Proficient with the Microsoft Office Suite; especially, PowerPoint.

  • Able to prioritise workload and respond well under pressure.

items.title: Designer
items.content:
Remote | International

LiveSurface is an industry leader in visualization and image creation tools for creatives. We blend leading technology with hand-curated content to provide realtime photorealistic visualization to our users. At our heart, we are a team of creatives that thrive on transforming challenging problems into beautifully implemented solutions.

Design thinking and beautiful visual expression are at the heart of LiveSurface, and our users are probably some of your favorite small and large studios. If you are as passionate about design as we are, and want to have a direct impact on a product that has high visibility within the design community, then we are looking for you.

What you’ll do:

  • Work on the next generation of LiveSurface visual materials
  • Work with the team to build a branding roadmap and define milestones.
  • Contribute to the overall brand vision.

Who you are:

  • A talented designer with a strong visual point of view.
  • A self-starter who loves what they do.
  • A fast learner, able to adapt to new visual styles and design applications.
  • Up-to-date with the latest Adobe products.
  • An English speaker with strong communication skills.
  • Able to blend modern typography and a clean visual sensibility.

We offer:

  • Remote work and a flexible schedule.
  • A wide range of challenging creative projects.
  • A stable, revenue-based structure with an existing product (on the market for 5+ years).
  • Broad exposure: Your work will be seen and loved by thousands of fellow creatives.
  • A highly acclaimed platform with a loyal user base.
  • A small, friendly team.
  • Product-focused, non-corporate management.

Extras that will make you stand out:

  • Experience with video editing, content writing or other design-related areas.
  • Knowledge of any of the web-oriented programming languages.
  • An existing LiveSurface user.
Apply for job

items.content:
AirGrid... what is that?


A platform for privacy preserving machine learning on the web, pioneering a new approach to distributed AI running on edge devices. The internet is changing to a more private & secure place, in which companies own less data collected from web users. We are building for this new future, with the core tenant of the platform helping to preserve the privacy of individuals whilst allowing the advance of AI & ML based products & services.


-----


We are looking for a contract UX/UI designer to join our team on an ongoing but part time basis.


We are a small team building a privacy preserving ML platform for the web.


Please take a look at https://airgrid.io for more details on the product.


This is a remote role, but we are accepting applications from Europe.


To apply please submit: 
- a link to a B2B web app you have designed and are most proud of! 
- your hourly rate
- available start date


Thanks and stay safe!

items.title: Web4Realty: Creative Website Designer
items.content:
Creative Website Designer

Introduction

MEET A FEW OF OUR TEAM MEMBERS HERE!

Web4Realty has a big vision. We launched in 2011, serve thousands of real estate agents across Canada and US, and haven’t even scratched the surface. Our plan is to take over North America and become the go-to software for real estate professionals.

We’re looking for a Remote Creative Website Designer to join our growing team. This remote position allows you to work from home, or wherever you’re most productive. We’re looking for smart, creative, and motivated people who have a passion for helping clients turn their visions to realities.

If you’re looking to grow your career by joining one of the fastest-growing providers in the industry, we want to hear from you!


Company

Web4Realty was founded in 2011, and has quickly become an industry leader in real estate tech industry. Since day one, we’ve prided ourselves on being a company that solves real problems for our clients. We're an ambitious group, and have a strong belief in being supportive and accommodating, while empowering our team members to be optimal in their roles.

Team culture is the most important thing to us. Without a dedicated and cohesive team, we wouldn’t be able to make the strides that we have. Working at Web4Realty is one of the most unique work opportunities you will ever experience. We're committed to transparency, collaboration, experimentation, and always staying classy.

Because of this unique remote culture, we've established one of the most flexible and well designed work environments around that encourages you to work as you work best. Ensuring that our team members are healthy, motivated, focused and creative is how Web4Realty stays awesome. In a nutshell, we've built and are growing a place where we truly love working, and we think you will too.

We're also very proud to be 100% bootstrapped and revenue-financed. We’re a fully remote company, with team members distributed across eight countries around the world (and growing).

Web4Realty is expanding to markets across North America, and couldn’t be more excited - we are just getting started!


What we offer?
  • Enforced happy lifestyle
  • Competitive salary
  • Revenue sharing
  • Flexible schedules
  • Paid vacation
  • Personally tailored growth opportunities

Position

One of the key services we provide to our clients is website design. We offer one of the most robust and dynamic website builders in the world. Because of how customizable our PageManager CMS is, we’re able to create some of the most beautiful real estate websites on the market.

As a Remote Website Designer, you’ll utilize PageManager to complete website projects for clients in a professional and timely manner. After a design project is sold, you’ll be accountable for speaking with clients directly, understanding their needs, fulfill their orders to meet their requirements - and most importantly, put a smile on their face!


Required Skills
  • Has worked remotely for +3 years
  • Extensive experience with several website builders
  • Has an eye for beautiful design
  • Amazing customer service
  • Great communicator
  • Knows Photoshop well
  • A great troubleshooter
  • Time management skills

items.content:
UI Designer (60-80%)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Designer, Frontend Developer
Industry: Architecture, Search Engine
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: buildup AG – No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Berlin +/- 2 hours

Technologies

angular
scss
typescript
user-experience
gitlab

Job description

Wir transformieren aktuell unsere gesamte Server-Codebase und haben erfolgreich ein kleines Team rekrutiert, das unser Backend (in Spring) baut und dir jede Menge JSONs schicken möchte... denn du sollst hauptverantwortlich das neue Frontend auf Basis von Angular entwickeln. Dabei kommt es vor allen Dingen darauf an, dass du den Nutzer im Blick behältst, dass du sagst, welche Informationen wo zusammenfließen sollen, wie man die Wege kurz hält und die Informationen strukturiert darstellt.

Du solltest mehrere Jahre Erfahrung in der Entwicklung mit Angular haben, gut mit HTML und SCSS umgehen können und sicher darin sein, einfache Events mit TypeScript zu handlen. Komplexere Berechnungen und das Zusammenziehen der Informationen erledigt das Backend, so dass du dich aufs Design (auch für Mobile Devices) und die UserExperience konzentrieren kannst.

Dafür ist es auch nötig, eng mit Externen und anderen Firmenmitgliedern außerhalb der Entwicklung zusammenzuarbeiten, so dass du Deutsch auf Niveau C2 beherrschen musst. Entwicklungsintern sprechen wir viel Englisch, dafür genügt aber Niveau B2.

Wir haben für den Start ein Webshop-Template gekauft und bereits Internationalisierung mit i18n eingebaut. Jetzt brauchen wir dich – bewirb dich mit einigen deiner bisherigen Projekte – zeig uns, was du magst und worauf du stolz bist. Und: wir schätzen es sehr, wenn du Teilzeit arbeitest - wir wollen deine produktiven Stunden beim Coding und dir den Rest für echte Erholung, Hobbies und viel Zeit mit den anderen Dingen und Menschen, die du magst, lassen.

Easy apply

About buildup AG

Wir sind ein kleines Team - entsprechend groß werden deine Einflussmöglichkeiten. Du verantwortest deine Features selbst, von Planung über Umsetzung bis zum Betrieb und darfst entsprechend viel auch selbst entscheiden.

Wir sind EntwicklerInnen und kennen EntwicklerInnen: wir wollen, dass du produktiv arbeiten und deine Freizeit genießen kannst.

Benefits

  • HomeOffice - arbeite, wo Du willst
  • Teilzeit - arbeite Deine produktiven Stunden und hab Zeit für Dich
  • Starkes MacBook, produktive Apps (Slack, IntelliJ,...)
  • Wir sind ein Team - auch über Ländergrenzen hinweg
  • Bring deine Idee ein: was du verantwortest, darfst du auch entscheiden

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=5, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=16, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Remote | Freelance

at PlayQ (View all jobs)

Remote

About Us:

PlayQ is a rapidly growing mobile gaming studio based in the heart of sunny Santa Monica. Our titles have been downloaded over 60 million times worldwide, with millions of users playing our games every day!

Our goal is to deliver tomorrow’s nostalgic game experiences to a global audience and we rely on our dedicated team to craft these unforgettable games that our users love. We believe that the best games come from diverse teams with a shared desire to create something amazing. From our beachfront headquarters to our innovative tech stack, it’s no surprise that PlayQ was named as one of the 2018 Best Places to Work in Los Angeles by the Los Angeles Business Journal.

We’re looking for people who have a genuine love for their craft and we invite you to join us in this exciting endeavor.

Job Overview:

PlayQ is looking for an imaginative Senior 2D Concept Artist to concept and illustrate whimsical environments, props, icons, and characters. This position will work remotely collaborating with the Art Director and Design team to create and deliver concepts that are fun, fantastical, and appealing to a mass market.

Responsibilities in this role will range from rough sketch concepts to final illustrative render in certain instances. This position offers an exciting opportunity to concept a wide variety of themes and environments while working with an expert-level art team to deliver polished art to millions of players around the world.

This is an off-site, contract position with competitive hourly pay, based on experience. The position requires 40 hours per week, which includes creating new concept art and collaborating with our cross-functional team.

Responsibilities:

  • Create compelling 2D concepts of whimsical environments, props, and characters
  • Collaborate with 3D artists to direct final modeling and render of concepts
  • Add final paint over polish to 3D renders to enhance color, lighting, and details.
  • Create storyboards and 2d animatics

Requirements:

  • 5+ years of concept artist experience
  • Expert in Adobe Creative Suite
  • Ability to adapt style to match style references and art direction
  • Motivated, driven, and excited about design and game art, particularly casual game art with mass market appeal.
  • Willingness to accept and provide constructive criticism
  • Ability to effectively manage time and work efficiently in a remote capacity and within a deadline driven environment

Bonus Points:

  • Knowledge of Unity Game Engine
  • Experience with 3D software

Perks:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Work remotely with flexible hours
  • Collaborate with an exceptionally talented, knowledgeable, and supportive team!
  • Help build and support awesome GAMES. For a living! Who doesn’t love games?
Apply for job

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=8, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=41}
items.content:
Remote | International

Location: Raleigh, NC, London, UK, or Remote

Our Customers Develop Software at the Speed of Ideas

CloudBees is powering the continuous economy by offering the world’s first end-to-end continuous software delivery management system (SDM). For millions of developers and product teams driving innovation for businesses large or small, SDM builds on continuous integration (CI) and continuous delivery (CD) to enable all functions and teams within and around the software delivery organization to best work together to amplify value creation.

CloudBees is the continuous integration (CI), continuous delivery (CD) and application release automation (ARA) powerhouse built from the commercial success of its products and its open source leadership as the largest contributor to Jenkins and a founding member of the Continuous Delivery Foundation (CDF). With a globally distributed workforce of more than 500 employees, the company reflects the global nature of the DevOps movement. We believe in walking the talk! From startups with full-stack developers practicing NoOps to large Fortune 100 companies, CloudBees enables all software-driven organizations to intelligently deploy the right capabilities at the right time.

Over 3,500 of the world’s best known brands and over 50% of the Fortune 500, invest in CloudBees because of its ability to work across any cloud, in any development environment and to balance corporate governance and control with developer flexibility and freedom.

CloudBees is home to the world’s leading DevOps experts helping thousands of companies harness the power of continuous everything and putting them on the fastest path from great idea, to great software, to great business value.

Working at CloudBees

Because CloudBees is a fully distributed company, it is able to draw on a global talent pool and maintain a very high bar for intellect, technical skill and most importantly work culture. Nearly every Bee has chosen to work at CloudBees because of a personal conviction of the transformative power of continuous delivery practices in every function in software development. This leads to a sense of shared mission and mutual respect that makes CloudBees a truly special place to work.

What you will do

At CloudBees you’ll join a strong team of designers that is mission-critical to CloudBees’ success. We believe in the value of design thinking in every stage of a project, from initial research to delivery and iteration.

As a Senior UX Designer, you will have a chance to shape not only our product but also our design process and culture.

  • Utilize design thinking methodologies from empathy to rapid prototyping to arrive at creative, intuitive end-to-end experiences
  • Leverage and/or conduct user research to inform design decisions and evaluate your designs
  • Clearly and effectively communicate ideas, research findings, sketches, and other deliverables to the business and leadership
  • Design and deliver user stories, user journeys, wireframes, prototypes, and UI specifications in an agile and collaborative environment.
  • Move between making strategic and tactical design decisions regularly to devise elegant solutions within a complex business domain
  • Communicate a strong point of view informed by customer insights, design principles, and industry trends yet hold it only loosely.
  • Establish and manage relationships with key stakeholders including product managers, marketing, and engineering teams to align with and achieve business objectives
  • Give and solicit feedback from other designers in order to continually raise the bar for design quality and collaborate across the Design team to ensure consistency and transparency
  • Create the interfaces that some of the world’s largest brands depend on – Adobe, Invision, Capital One, Citrix, Accenture ~50% of fortune 500 companies use our technology to build their own.

What the role requires

  • 6+ years of experience as a user experience designer, interaction designer, product designer, or similar, leading and delivering comprehensive and elegant end-to-end solutions within a complex business environment.
  • Proven experience designing technical SaaS products with large feature sets or complex dashboards
  • Proven ability to collaborate with other designers, developers, and stakeholders to transform complex technical problems into beautiful, simple user experiences.
  • Experience with conducting user research and usability testing
  • Self-motivated and able to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Fully proficient in English written and spoken language
  • Strong communication skills, including the ability to articulate decisions and problem statements to stakeholders, customers, and other team members
  • Ability to work effectively in a remote environment, across time-zones; including experience presenting work to team members and stakeholders remotely and/or asynchronously
  • Extensive experience designing within a design system and maintaining good file hygiene while working within a team of other designers
  • Strong portfolio demonstrating expertise in SaaS application design, attention to detail, and strong experience with end to end design presentation
    • Please have examples that explore the development of a solution at different stages in the creative process (e.g. discovery, sketches, wireframes, layouts, prototypes, validation, etc.)
    • Please have examples of using testing or research to determine design direction and how you made an impact on a KPI
  • Basic understanding of html + css
  • Experience with project tracking tools such as Jira
  • Bonus:
    • Experience/knowledge of CI & CD tools such as Jenkins, CodeShip, Circle, Travis, or GitLab.
    • Experience with development tools such as Git, GitHub, and features like branching, forking, reverting, PRs, etc.
    • Proficiency with HTML, CSS, SASS
    • Understanding of JavaScript, and frameworks like jQuery, React, & Vue.
    • Understanding of the software development workflows

What You’ll Get

  • Highly competitive benefits and vacation package including stock options
  • Ability to work for one of the fastest-growing companies with some of the most talented people in the industry
  • Fun, Hardworking, and Casual Environment with the flexibility to work anywhere in the world the team is almost fully distributed around the globe (We also have several great office locations!)

At CloudBees, we truly believe that the more diverse we are, the better we serve our customers. A global community like Jenkins demands a global focus from CloudBees. Organizations with greater diversity gender, racial, ethnic, and global are stronger partners to their customers. Whether by creating more innovative products, or better understanding our worldwide customers, or establishing a stronger cross-section of cultural leadership skills, diversity strengthens all aspects of the CloudBees organization.

In the technology industry, diversity creates a competitive advantage. CloudBees customers demand technologies from us that solve their software development, and therefore their business problems, so that they can better serve their own customers. CloudBees attributes much of its success to its worldwide work force and commitment to global diversity, which opens our proprietary software to innovative ideas from anywhere. Along the way, we have witnessed firsthand how employees, partners, and customers with diverse perspectives and experiences contribute to creative problem solving and better solutions for our customers and their businesses.

Apply for job

items.title: Whitespectre: Senior UI/UX designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=13}
items.content:
Senior UI/UX designer

We are a remote-first company with a globally distributed team of 70. We’re proud of the way we get great work done. Our clients love working with us and we partner with them on long-term projects. Our teams are engaged and excited about our work.

We’re looking for a smart, hardworking, creative, and collaborative individual to help us create beautiful, intuitive and engaging experiences for our client partners. 

Only candidates who are based outside of the US will be considered for this role.  The position can be remote or within our offices in Barcelona.  Our working hours are typically 11am to 8pm BCN time. 

Please provide a link to your current portfolio. Candidates without portfolios will not be considered.

What You’ll Do 

Our projects are a combination of launching then evolving brand-new products, as well as taking existing products to the next level.  In this role, you’ll collaborate closely with product managers, engineers, the wider UX team, and our client partners to deliver beautiful, engaging experiences.  That’s everything from wires and prototyping, to gathering user feedback, to presenting to stakeholders, to designing polished interfaces, and overall, working hand in hand with the team to ensure that the software and mobile apps we create both look and ‘feel’ great.  

As an ideal candidate, you’ll have: 

  • Several years experience in UI/UX design, with experience designing both responsive sites and applications as well as native mobile applications (IOS, Android, React Native).
  • Experience working within a team across the entire product lifecycle, from research and prototyping, to launch, to ongoing feedback and iteration cycles. 
  • A robust portfolio of past projects and live examples you can walk us through
  • A design aesthetic that demonstrates a strong foundation in the core visual design principles (typography, layout, color, etc.)
  • Excellent communication skills in English.  Because of our close collaboration with our English-speaking clients, you must be able to engage confidently with them in design discussions. 
To be successful in this role, you’ll also be:

  • Passionate about creating products that deliver both a first-class user experience as well as real business results. 
  • Seriously detail-oriented.  You pride yourself on delivering designs that are accurate and consistent. You enjoy thinking through the multiple scenarios and perspective in each user experience you create. 
  • Committed to keeping up with ‘best practices’ and new design thinking.  You’re naturally curious, you’re constantly reviewing new apps and products, you can speak comfortably on the pros and cons of the latest design trends
  • Skilled at presenting your designs and findings with clarity and confidence and engaging in stakeholder discussions 
  • Comfortable in fast-paced, collaborative environments.
